title: [feature request] Add TensorFlow's bfloat16
body_html: TensorFlow defines a floating point number with 16 bits that is different from the IEEE 754 standard; one bit is for the sign, eight are exponent bits, and seven are mantissa bits. It is essentially a 32 bit float with less precision. More information can be found here and here.
body_text: TensorFlow defines a floating point number with 16 bits that is different from the IEEE 754 standard; one bit is for the sign, eight are exponent bits, and seven are mantissa bits. It is essentially a 32 bit float with less precision. More information can be found here and here.
body: TensorFlow defines a floating point number with 16 bits that is different from the IEEE 754 standard; one bit is for the sign, eight are exponent bits, and seven are mantissa bits. It is essentially a 32 bit float with less precision. More information can be found [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/1e44b15ff02fe3bf4764189eb1b796602d669c3e/tensorflow/core/framework/bfloat16.h) and [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bfloat16_floating-point_format).
